title: Bandelier National Monument: Mammals
body: Mammals         Mule deer can be found in all parts of the park and frequently can be seen on the Main Loop Trail. Photo by Sally King  Bandelier National Monument is home to over 55 species of mammals including sixteen species of bats, mule deer, Abert's squirrels, and mountain lions. Other mammals such as Bighorn sheep and Grizzly bear used to roam the park's canyons and mesas but were eradicated by human activities.       In winter, it is not uncommon to see elk herds in the area and along the park entrance road. Photo by Sally King                    Mammals of Bandelier   9 Photos  Bandelier is home to a wide variety of mammals that find the park's diversity of habitats a good place to thrive.
